meanings.definition: Notes or comments written in the margins of a book.
meanings.sent1: I found interesting marginalia in my textbook.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the marginalia in old novels.
meanings.sent3: The marginalia in the cookbook made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His journal was filled with colorful marginalia.
meanings.sent5: The professor asked us to analyze the marginalia for our assignment.

meanings.definition: The practice of writing in the margins of a book.
meanings.sent1: Marginalia can enhance your understanding of a text.
meanings.sent2: Students should engage in the habit of marginalia.
meanings.sent3: The art of marginalia is like a secret language.
meanings.sent4: Her love for marginalia grew with each book she read.
meanings.sent5: The librarian appreciated the care taken in the marginalia.

meanings.definition: The collection of marginal notes or comments in a book.
meanings.sent1: The library displayed a rare collection of marginalia.
meanings.sent2: He studied the marginalia to learn more about the author.
meanings.sent3: The auction house sold a valuable set of marginalia.
meanings.sent4: The historian examined the marginalia for historical insights.
meanings.sent5: The book club discussed the significance of the marginalia.
